posts.text:
Movies starring The Rock (an actor who is impossible to dislike) tend to draw online movie reviews that divide camps.

This division more often than not painfully contrasts The Rocks effortless charisma with the projects he (or his agent) chooses that never really stand a chance of showcasing his not inconsiderable abilities and benign likeability.

Central Intelligence does its best to widen this division into a Grand Canyon-sized ravine overflowing like an illegal landfill with discarded possibilities.

The unoriginal premise is promising enough as a set up, with The Rock and co-star the ever-ingratiating Kevin Hart (who is much easier to dislike) buoying us along, just helping us keep our heads above the rising waters of inanity.

The plot (if it matters) involves a once-bullied nerd, Bob (played by The Rock), who in adulthood becomes a crack CIA agent. He comes home for his high school reunion, enlisting former 'big man on campus', Calvin (played by Hart), who is only too happy to go along with this shtick as he longs for his glory days.

An action and comedy-free action-comedy from one of modern cinemas leading action stars is an impressive achievement on many levels. It is regrettable that this does not extend to the viewing level.
posts.title: Central Intelligence Seriously Lacking Any

posts.text:
What did you expect? I remember the anticipation surrounding this not-much-anticipated theatrical outing for two of Britains best loved TV comedy characters delivers on a) the TV shows premise, and b) the title.

And that, frankly, is enough certainly for hardcore fans, anyway. (Disclaimer, I had always been a huge fan.)

Sure, the jury is out on whether the catch-us-if-you-can narrative is a natural expansion of the more contained nature of the sit-com format.

But fans wont care, and neither should you. The movie boasts more than its fair share of jokes that hit their mark, in what is admittedly a pretty scattershot approach to their inclusion in a cameo-studded story (what there is of it), penned by Jennifer Saunders.

Add to this mix gallons of Bolly and mountains of caviar, darlings, and watching Eddie and Patsy fabulous-it-up if nothing else cranks up the nostalgia meter.

Even if it mostly hits the funny bone with nothing more substantial than a plastic toy croquet mallet.
posts.title: Absolutely Fabulous, Er, Mostly Is

posts.text:
Dont misunderstand me: I like Johnny Depp and Tim Burton. I am less of a fan of seeing them together in every film Burton concocts, Depps insistence on oddball characters, fed by Burtons skewed, self-consciously bizarre sensibilities, distorting what otherwise might be interesting films.

Fortunately, they seem to have finally woken up to the reality that I am not the only one who thinks this.


Case in point: Alice Under The Magnifying Glass. It somehow seems right (if a tad unfair) to blame Tim Burton for this whimsical, Back to the Future-lite trip down a rabbit hole into an unimaginative world of style over substance.


Admittedly that style is something to behold, but it can't make up for a film that is trading too heavily off nostalgia for Lewis Carol's classic tale.


As most honest film reviewers at the time of its release pointed out, the screenplay by Linda Woolverton, crazily decided that, in this cinematic world, the Mad Hatter is actually if you take a closer look the protagonist and Alice is actually an admittedly girl power-PC supporting player. (Take that, Lewis Carol.)


Hokay. If Woolverton had reread the title of the story they were paying her big bucks to adapt she might have been a bit more clued in on what it is about the narrative that audiences respond to. It's like making Q the hero in the James Bond films or decking Lois Lane out in spandex and making us believe a woman can fly. It simply fails to capture the spirit of the original text.


And that's where Burton needs to take part of the blame. For some reason it took a string of stupendous flops for him and Johnny Depp to realise their collaborations were turning in ever-diminishing creative and commercial returns, producing films for an audience of zero and leaving us with lifelessly 'whimsical' Depp incarnations as a result. (Dark Shadows anyone?)


But Johnny Depp probably figured a new director, James Bobin (he of Muppets Most Wanted fame, so you can see where this is going), might breathe life into his performance in the same way Gore Verbinksi did in the first three Pirates of the Caribbean movies. And so Depp's name (and ego) triumphed over that of the titular Alice. Um. Sure.


Fail. Rango was more three dimensional.


But as a sheer multi-layer visual spectacle (especially Johnny Depp's mesmerising eye makeup) it works on a surprising number of levels. If you can get past Depp's curiously inert performance it's worth watching with the family as an enjoyable, if undemanding, two hour diversion.
posts.title: Alice Under The Magnifying Glass  Lets Take A Closer Look

posts.text:
If were honest with ourselves on a deep primal level, The Purge franchise seems designed to appeal to horror-gore fans who crave a movie that serves as a pretext to render their blood lust defensible.


Not unlike the concept of The Purge: Election Year itself, actually.


To be honest, this is why I have always loved the premise: not because I personally need said defensibility in my movie diet, but because the type of audience the films themselves draw are comments on the carnage depicted onscreen. Very meta.


And a neat idea. As a high-concept idea (one night a year, all crime is legal) The Purge is more immediately emotionally and psychologically impactful than pretty much anything since The Matrix, which forced us to question the very nature of reality and our existence.


The premise for The Purge immediately presents the viewer with a new perspective on his or her world, and asks us to reconsider our moral and socio-political stance.


The movies themselves? (I said I love the premise.) Well, they're less impressive in an underwhelming, B-movie kind of way.


The trilogy shares the same nagging problem (the third instalment in particular): whereas this idea could actually use a lighter, more nuanced writing and directing touch while digging deeper into the psychology behind those who purge, what the writer-director, James DeMonaco seems intent on giving us is a viscerally exciting but intellectually bankrupt action-horror franchise.


Which is a shame: the meanderingly spiky and combative psychology that exists behind our fragile, socially constructed facades potentially runs very deep. To sacrifice all that for a series of simplistic messages about inequality in America bubbling beneath the surface of all three movies seems like a waste of a great idea.
posts.title: The Purge: Election Year Is Still A Great Concept, But...

posts.text:
A keen Tarzan fan (from Johnny Weissmuller to Christopher Lambert), the anticipation I felt when I heard The Legend of Tarzan would do the character justice was palpable.

And did it? Not exactly. The Legend of Tarzan is a curiously inert affair.

At its essence, the film is a game of two halves: the first half delivers adequately, if unoriginally, in the straightforward, action adventure stakes. The second half despite its impressive budget has a problem with the special effects; not a King Kong level of CGI fail, but a fail nonetheless.

Somehow they actually cheapen as the film progresses, leaving audiences open-mouthed with an absurdly epic finale that looks like a first year film students CGI show reel.

The director, David Yates (he of Harry Potter fame) can take some credit for at least attempting to update the film The Lord of Greystoke-tsyle for modern sensibilities. But ultimately his efforts fall flat. The quasi starry cast (Alexander Skarsgrd is no Christopher Lambert hes barely Wolf Larson) do their best with the material, but the thing just feels too simplified to make any impact.

The sweeping visuals are nice, the story and script, not so much. (George of the Jungle had a better grip on plot mechanics, pacing and narrative arcs.)

In this reimaging, we catch up with Tarzan years after he left the jungle; now John Clayton III, Lord Greystoke, the sluggish plot mechanics manage, at a glacial pace, to manoeuvre him into a role as a trade emissary of Parliament. The Belgian Captain, Leon Rom (Christoph Waltz playing his usual rent-a-foreign-sounding-bad-guy) is hell bent on conquest enslaving the inhabitants of the Congo, forcing Tarzan to fight once more.

You can guess who/what hes helped out by.

Best revisiting the true feral-eyed menace Skarsgrd was attempting to ape (pun intended) and rent Greystoke: The Legend of Tarzan, Lord of the Apes.
posts.title: The Legend Of Tarzan Swings Low

posts.text:
When The Secret Life of Pets came out a lot of reviewers were quick to point out the obvious: the movie is essentially Toy Story (a firm favourite in our household) with the toys replaced by a menagerie of furry critters. Is it as good as that Pixar classic?

No, but the creative minds behind this inoffensive comedy are getting there.

The set up is straightforward: its literally a carbon copy of Toy Story: when we leave for work our pets become eccentric, anthropomorphised talking critters.

Er, thats it, really.

Sure, The Secret Life of Pets lacks anything substantial going on beneath the surface shenanigans in terms of plot, character motivations or pathos.

That said, the jokes are generally sharp enough to be funny for both kids and parents, the scares not too scary, and the whole thing has the effervescent appeal of a ice cream float: enjoyable while it lasts but not much substance beyond the ice cream and bubbles.

Certainly, the collaboration between Illumination Entertainment and Universal Pictures is one to watch (this being their fifth fully-animated feature). Director Chris Renaud (Despicable Me, Despicable Me 2) knows his way round a live cartoon, and the vocal talent acquits themselves admirably.

But, ultimately, it just feels a bit 'samey' round the edges, like a joke the teller doesn't know someone else has already told several times before.

Its no dogs dinner by a long way: pity there couldnt have been more narrative and emotional meat on its bones.
posts.title: The Secret Life Of Pets Formula No Secret

posts.text:
It seems Jared Leto was taking the Heath Ledger route into the jokers warped and wonderful psyche.

A ClevverMovies News Feed video at the time a great channel for current movie reviews and all the latest Hollywood gossip had the scoop on the actors dive into dark hilarity and madness.

From comments Leto made in the press, along with reports of his on-set antics with his co-stars, it seems Leto is taking method acting to a level that would have Marlon Brando turning in his grave and mumbling now thats just taking things too far, kid.

Said antics include sending a gift of a boxed rat to co-star Margot Robbie, who plays Harley Quinn in the film, and asking co-star Jim Parrack, who plays henchman Jonny Frost, to spray paint roses black.

Hokey dokey. Yep. You heard it here first. Make sure youre up to speed on the evil joking jesters legacy before the baton is passed on from Leto to... the jury is still out on that one.

But at this point, sources say Letos days as the Joker likely are over. He did not reprise the role for Warners' upcoming DC movies Birds of Prey (a spinoff centered on Robbie's Harley Quinn) or in James Gunn's The Suicide Squad, due out in 2021. Says one person involved in the situation: "How do you play the Joker you established following [Phoenix]? It kind of ends his Joker run.
posts.title: Jared Leto: Method In His Madness?

posts.text:
Oh why oh why why oh why why oh why do you continue to do this to us, Ridley?

Explain to me and Alien fans everywhere why you are so intent on destroying what is arguably the most beloved franchise in all sci-fi a franchise you started, and in spectacular, mesmerising fashion?

Where to begin? Easy. Lets begin with the instalment where goodwill started to wither and die: Prometheus.

The problem with Prometheus isn't only that the movie plays like Ridley Scott hasn't been in a cinema for the last 40 years.

That sin can maybe be forgiven. The problem is when he was famously called on his film's (apparently) nonsensical plot, he and his writer (he of the incomprehensible final episode of Lost, Damon Lindelof) went out of their way to suggest it was the audience who didn't understand it.

Jeez. Seriously? I mean, what? It's the audience's job to make sense of a writer's lesser efforts now? It's our fault?

Suggesting your story was somehow so elevated and oblique that the simple-minded masses of the movie going public wouldn't get it, is fine so long as you're producing an arthouse student pic on a shoestring budget. Not a $100 mill plus commercial blockbuster.

Every honest movie review written at the time of the film's release agreed on one thing: the film simply lacked any discernible structure that could have reasonably couched a recycled story that was actually more derivative and less original than 95% of the fan fiction doing the rounds at the time.

But maybe this judgement is too harsh? Google Prometheus explained and youll find half a dozen videos that 'explain' why there are actually no plot holes in the movie (which smacks of someone explaining why a joke actually is funny, and youre too dumb or morose to get it).
posts.title: Prometheus  More Plot Holes Than Story

posts.text:
The Wayward Pines book series (which I had already devoured) is a lot like the Wayward Pines reviews for season one and two of the popular Fox miniseries: they start out positive but take a distinctly lethargic slide as the weird goings-on progress in the titular town.

The original series with M. Night Shyamalan going some way to redeeming his earlier promise by stepping into the more utilitarian shoes of executive producer initially managed to balance the Wayward Pines cast of oddball characters with engaging story lines.

Fast forward to the middle of season two (which is as far as I have got with the box set, and, with Walking Dead-like fatigue setting in, may be as far as I go) and its becoming pretty clear that the novelty of the premise ran out after the weak, tacked on ending to season one. (Predictably trite endings, regrettably, being another Shyamalan mainstay.)

Taking the Walking Dead route of gleefully offing big names in order to keep the audience guessing isnt enough to justify its existence.

posts.text:
IFK Gteborg has a proud history. The football team from Sweden's second largest city won the UEFA cup twice in the 80s, and had success in Europe in the 90s, together with the second most wins in the Swedish top league, Allsvenskan. Recently though, the times has been hard for "the Angels", as they have been facing lower rankings and worse results these last four years. Twice have they fought for survival, at risk of being demoted to the second league. The coach has been changed twice, as well as the manager and the head of the board. The sale of such players as Benjamin Nygren has been keeping the finances above water, but the margins are small in a medium sized league such as Allsvenskan.


When IFK Gteborg first started to stumble, back in 2017, a new coach was recruited. Poya Asbaghi was a young success, who had lead the team Degerfors to surprising heights. He was brought in, and ambitions were high, IFK was going to play a new kind of football with more continental flair and a focus on technically advanced players and tactics. The old model, with long shots and more physical players was being phased out. However, the results were mixed. The weak economy, along with a struggling offense and a questionable defense was just not good enough. Faced with critique, Asbaghi would say that the fundamentals were good, the rest was just details that needed to be fixed and the team would rise in the table. Every fan could see this, and that made it all the more frustrating. Potential goals that were being wasted, players that should have been stars were being plagued by bad confidence, the enemy teams being able to surprise IFK Gteborg and score a goal within the first five minutes were all too common scenes. While Asbaghi had won the Swedish Cup with the team, the confidence in him and his continuous pleas for more time was running out. Something had to be done, and soon, before IFK Gteborg would be demoted to the second league for the first time in 50 years. The new IFK Gteborg was slowly being scrapped, and the team returned to the basics.


Older and more routined heroes of the last great era of the club were being brought in. The staple names in the Swedish national team and close friends, midfielder Pontus Wernbloom and defender Mattias Bjrsmyr joined the club from their successful international careers. These players would act as an anchor for the otherwise quite young team and make a difference during the training. After this, the coach Poya Asbaghi was being replaced by an old club veteran, Roland Nilsson. Nilsson had played for IFK in the 90s, infamous for missing a penalty against Manchester United, cutting the club's international prospects short. Roland's mission was simple: save the contract in Allsvenskan. That he did, by going back to the basics of traditional Gothenburger football. Long shots, physical players, a will to win. The manager, Max Markusson, was being replaced by an old club legend and successful entrepreneur, Hkan Mild, while the board recieved a major overhaul. In just six months, both the club and the team has aged significantly, as the focus has ben directed wholly towards winning the next game.


Add to this that a few of the younger players have already left or are being prospected to leave, and the joke about IFK Gteborg being a team of old men might not be farfetched after all. Plus, two more national team players and club veterans are being believed to join the team in the summer, after the european championships: Marcus Berg, forward, and Oscar Wendt, left-back. With this, IFK Gteborg should have a seriously competitive team, and do well in the league. On the other hand, these homecomers are quite old and looking to end their careers in Gothenburg. Will the team be able to handle the aging, or will it fail to bring up new talent and overspend on has-beens? The future will tell, but for the first time in years, there is hope among the Angels.
posts.title: A brighter future for IFK Gteborg?

posts.text:
In a letter to Congress on Thursday, Mr Biden wrote that the order was "unwarranted" and said that no further tax dollars will be spent on the wall. Mr Trump declared a state of emergency over the southern border in 2019, which allowed him to bypass Congress and use military funds for its construction.

When Mr Trump left office, about $25bn (18bn) had been spent on the project.

The announcement from President Biden is the latest in a series of executive orders that have rolled back key parts of the former president's agenda. Last week, Mr Biden signed orders seeking to reunite migrant families split up by Trump-era policies, and ordered a probe of his predecessor's immigration agenda.

In a letter on Thursday, Mr Biden wrote that he would also seek a review of "all resources appropriated or redirected" to the construction of the wall.Building a border wall was a signature pledge of Mr Trump's 2016 presidential campaign. But the project faced strong opposition in the Democratic-controlled House, and the Republican president announced he would use emergency powers to fund its construction.

An emergency declaration allows US presidents to circumvent the usual political process and to access military funding.Various types of fencing totalling 654 miles (just over 1,000 km) were already in place before Mr Trump became president in 2017. During his his time in office, 80 miles of new barriers were built where there were none before, and almost 400 miles replaced existing parts of the structure.
posts.title: President Biden cancels funding for Trump border wall

posts.text:
The Empire stands triumphant.

For twenty years the Dread Empress has ruled over the lands that were once the Kingdom of Callow, but behind the scenes of this dawning golden age threats to the crown are rising. The nobles of the Wasteland, denied the power they crave, weave their plots behind pleasant smiles. In the north the Forever King eyes the ever-expanding borders of the Empire and ponders war. The greatest danger lies to the west, where the First Prince of Procer has finally claimed her throne: her people sundered, she wonders if a crusade might not be the way to secure her reign. Yet none of this matters, for in the heart of the conquered lands the most dangerous man alive sat across an orphan girl and offered her a knife.

Her name is Catherine Foundling, and she has a plan.


-----------





https://practicalguidetoevil.wordpress.com/
posts.title: A really great webfiction

posts.text:
Can you teach me about crypto? is my favorite question and also the hardest to answer. I love talking about crypto, especially introducing new people to it. However, I have noticed that each person requires a slightly different explanation. Everyone comes into this with a different level of understanding and for different reasons. Some people come for the technology, some for the revolution, some people want to make money, some are just sick of losing it. This is meant to be a bare bones introduction to cryptocurrency that ANYONE can follow. By the end you will know what Bitcoin is, why it is useful, and how to transact in it.





What is money?

Your True Wealth is your time and freedom. -Mike Maloney, Secrets of Money


*Money = Value

-When you trade your work for a paycheck you are turning your physical/mental energy into monetary energy.

*Money Is a tool for capturing that monetary energy and storing it as a representation of the value you have created.

-For something to represent value, people have to trust that it will stay valuable until they are ready to redeem that value in the future.


What is the difference between money and currency?

Currency is the local medium or unit through which money is transferred.

Currency is: -A medium of exchange

-A unit of account

-Portable

-Durable

-Divisible

-Fungible(interchangeable)

Money is: Everything Currensy is PLUS a store of value over a long period of time. Meaning that it maintains its purchasing power.

*We will examine these properties in detail in the next section.


EX: **Gold = Money **United State Dollar = Currency


Why Should I Care?

-Gold is an example of money. But Gold is cumbersome to carry around with you. Dollars were created to represent the value of the Gold that they were backed by.

- Up until 1971, for every $20 bill in your pocket, there existed $20 worth of Gold in a vault somewhere. Dollars were just a claim check for the Gold.

-People now had to trust in other people rather than the asset itself. Trust is what gives USD its value.

-One property that makes Gold a great store of value is its scarcity. It cannot be created from nothing. Dollars can be printed from thin air(paper or digital).. And the more dollars that are created, the less each one is worth. Prices don't go up, the value of each Dollar goes down.

-All fiat currencies in history have eventually gone to ZERO. The US dollar has lost 98% of its value since the creation of the Federal Reserve in 1913. Does that sound like a good place to store value to you?


*30% of all the United States Dollars that exist were printed in the year 2020.

*80% since the creation of Bitcoin in 2009

Why Gold Has Been King


- Gold's scarcity makes it such a good store of value that it is able to keep up with and even outpace the average fiat currency inflation rate.


-Holding USD you can expect to lose 3-5% of your purchasing power every year. Holding that same value in Gold you can expect to increase your purchasing power by 8-10% per year.

-Similar thinking can be applied to stocks, bonds, real estate, etc.


-The point is that USD leaks value over time while Gold gains value.

-This is why the rich get richer and the poor get poorer. Rich people do not save Dollars, rich people hold assets.

-Gold may move slower than other assets but it acts as a safe hedge incase of volatile market conditions. This has made Gold the best store of value throughout history.



Money Properties of Gold

-A medium of exchange

- I can give it to someone in exchange for something of equal value

-You need to find someone who accepts Gold

- Gold is more of a store of value than a medium of exchange anyway


-A unit of account

- Measured value (1/10 oz gold coin = $200usd)

- Not practical to price low value items in Gold (cup of coffee)


-Portable

-You can carry a Gold coin in your pocket

-It is not practical to carry very much around with you.

-Expensive to ship large amounts very far

-Easily stolen/confiscated/lost


-Durable

- We are trading the same Gold today as they were 3000 years ago

- Can be worn down, damaged, lost, stolen, confiscated


-Divisible

-You can technically break down an oz in 1/10 oz coins to make change

- Not practical to split and weigh smaller denominations


-Fungible

-My ounce of Gold has the same value as your ounce of Gold.

-Must be verified, pure and trusted.


-Store of Value

-It maintains purchasing power over long periods of time.

-Keeps up with or even outpaces inflation rate

-Scarce and difficult to produce BUT we do not know how much exists.




What is Bitcoin?


Bitcoin is a decentralized payment network that eliminates the need for traditional intermediaries like banks and governments. It was created in the wake of the 2008 financial crisis as a hedge against an irresponsible, centralized financial system.

There are no physical Bitcoins, Instead there is a digital ledger that records every transaction and account balance, much like a normal bank would. The computers running the Bitcoin software are constantly checking with one another to validate these transactions and balances..

The Bitcoin software is open source and transparent, meaning that anyone can view the code and submit changes. Changes will only be implemented with a consensus of 51% of the network.

Bitcoin was created in 2009 by Satoshi Nakamoto, an anonymous person(s)


Why Bitcoin is Better.


Like Gold, Bitcoin is extremely scarce. Unlike Gold, we know the max supply of Bitcoin that will ever exist and the rate at which they will be produced.

By design, there will only ever be 21 million Bitcoin, with the rate at which they are produced being cut in half roughly every 4 years. (More detail on mining later.)

Today, roughly 18.5 million Bitcoin have been mined, an estimated 4 million are already lost forever. *It will be around 2140 when the last Bitcoin is mined.


Bitcoin runs simultaneously on a network of computers spread around the entire globe. This means there are no headquarters, no company, no CEO, no central entity in control.

The more computers supporting the network, the more secure it becomes.

Bitcoin transactions are borderless, permissionless, and trustless.


You can move a billion dollars in value to the other side of the planet in under 30 minutes for 5 bucks with nothing but the cellphone in your pocket.. This may not apply to you and I, but think of the value in a network like this.

Bank the unbanked. There are still roughly 2 Billion people on the planet without access to banks. You can transact in Bitcoin on a Nokia cellphone.

Books, Shopping,TV, Movies, Everything goes digital. And the digital version consumes the analog version. Our money is mostly digital anyway, but it still functions the same as archaic fiat currency.

In just the last few months we have seen the largest companies and wealthiest people in the world starting to adopt Bitcoin.

Trusted payment companies like Paypal and Visa are JUST now implementing Bitcoin into their systems as the asset has matured enough to be taken seriously.


* This is simple supply and demand. If something is scarce, but in high demand, the value can only increase. Bitcoin has doubled every year for over 10 years and is still only 1/20th the market cap of Gold, and thats just ONE asset with a 3000 year head start.


* We are at the beginning of the largest wealth transfer in history. There is more wealth in the world now than ever. MIllenials are just now entering the prime income stage of their lives.. As young, tech savvy investors seek the best option for preserving their wealth, monetary energy will continue to flow out of traditional assets and into digital assets like Bitcoin.

Money Properties of Bitcoin


-A medium of exchange

- I can give it to someone in exchange for something

- You need to find someone who accepts BTC, same as Gold

- SOLUTION: Services now exist to convert your BTC at the time of purchase.

-Like Gold, Bitcoin is more of a store of value than medium of exchange anyway.


-A unit of account

-Easily Measured value (1 BTC = 100,000,000 Sats = $40,000)

-Easily to price anything of any value, large or small.


-Portable

-You can carry as much as you want on your phone.

- If you memorize your key phrase, you could even carry your life savings to the other side of the planet... in your head.


-Durable

-Code doesnt deteriorate, it doesnt melt, it cant be scratched, worn down, etc.

- It cannot be stolen or confiscated

- YOU are in control. If you lose your key phrase, you lose your crypto.


-Divisible

-1 Satoshi = one hundred millionth of a single bitcoin

-Easily broken down into any value


-Fungible

-My Bitcoin has exactly the same value as any other Bitcoin


-Store of Value

-It maintains purchasing power over long periods of time.

- Extremely Scarce, we know with certainty that only 21 Million will ever exist, not even enough for every millionaire in the world to own if they wanted to.

-Gold outpaces inflation, but Bitcoin outpaces everything.

-For the last 10 years, Bitcoin has averaged over a 100% increase in purchasing power.

-Day to Day volatility, BUT

- This is normal for a brand new asset, remember how early we are in this process.

- There is $10,000,000,000(10T) invested in Gold ALONE

- There is only $600,000,000(600M) invested in Bitcoin






How Do I Use It?


Simply download an application on your cellphone.

For simplicity sake, I recommend buying Bitcoin on Coinbase or CashApp, but there are many great options. This is how you turn fiat currency into Bitcoin.

*We will dive into wallets and exchanges in another section.

Sending and receiving Bitcoin is as simple as entering the recipient's address, which can typically be found as a QR code, making it quick and easy to scan.


How Do I Know When To Buy?


When it comes to investing, you have 2 choices:

Try to buy the dip by timing the market bottoms

Dollar Cost Average(DCA) by purchasing small amounts at regular intervals over time regardless of price.

It may seem obvious to everyone that buying the dips would be the more lucrative strategy here, I would even think so myself.

However, when you back test the strategies side by side, DCA outperforms buying the dips(even if done perfectly) by 70% on average. This has been proven time and time again.

Dont take my word for it, check out this article by Nick Maggiulli if youd like to dig into the data and see how the numbers work out.

https://ofdollarsanddata.com/even-god-couldnt-beat-dollar-cost-averaging/

I recommend setting up your Coinbase or Cashapp to automatically DCA for you at whatever amount and schedule you are comfortable with. I set mine to automatically buy $25 every Sunday.


What are Alt-Coins?

Typically, anything other than Bitcoin is considered an Altcoin.

Bitcoin has its limitations, but it is also meant to. It works exactly as it works for a variety of reasons.

People have had all kinds of interesting ideas, but they were not what Bitcoin was created for, so the changes were never implemented.Instead people created new Blockchain projects. Today there are thousands, each with unique functionalities and purposes completely different from Bitcoin.

If altcoins interest you, start researching Ethereum and go from there!

posts.text:
Bitcoin bulls pushed the leading cryptocurrency to fresh all-time highs above $35,000 Tuesday night after a couple days of choppy price action kept traders guessing which direction the market would head next. The price is rising, andfast.
  • Bitcoin jumped nearly 12% Tuesday to top the previous record high of $34,544.94 set this past Sunday after adizzying climbover the New Year's weekend. After setting that mark, however, the price ofbitcoin(BTC, +9%)bounced between $32,500 and $34,500 followed by a swift drop to $28,000 with losses pared nearly just as quickly.
  • Bitcoin set a new all-time high of $35,106, just as this post was going live.
  • Throughout this price action, cryptocurrency traders starting cutting leveraged positions across the board, according toestimatescalculated by cryptocurrency data provider CryptoQuant. Taking toTwitter, CEO Ki Young Ju said the change signaled traders were "uncertain" and "scared" about the markets "next move."
  • With fresh record highs, the market's direction seems a bit more clear.
  • "It's rather simple I think," said Matt Kaye, managing partner at Santa Monica-based Blockhead Capital, talking to CoinDesk about bitcoin's price action. "There are more spot buyers than spot sellers going into a year that is likely going to transform US fiscal policy for the next decade."
  • Bitcoin's latest surge comes as results from the Senate runoff election in Georgia are coming in. Some a speculating a Democrat-controlled Congress could exacerbate current inflation concerns shared by many bitcoin investors.
  • Bitcoin has gained more than 20% so far in January following its more than 300% gain in 2020, driven largely by an influx of institutional investment.
posts.title: Story from Markets Bitcoin Sets New All-Time High Above $35K

posts.text:
There is significant concern among parents in Scotland (myself and my fellow parents included) that Scotland's schools are, according to the deputy first minister "safe", and that pupils due in this week should attend.

John Swinney said that, in his opinion (unsupported as far as official reports and statistics are available) the prevalence and spread (again unsupported) of the virus in Scotland was much lower than other parts of the UK.

The education secretary also told BBC Scotland he wanted to "stick to" 18 January as the date for face-to-face, in-class learning to restart after the holiday.

Calling for schools to be closed this week, Larry Flanagan of the EIS teaching union took a very different opinion to that of Mr. Swinney's.

Separately, the Scottish Conservatives have demanded that the government is more open about its post-Christmas plans.

Jamie Greene, the party's education spokesman, said greater detail and information was needed from Mr Swinney over how the education sector would be supported in the new year.

He added: "Little detail has been given as to why education has been put on hold and how on earth parents are expected to work when their childcare options have been taken away.

"There is no good reason why all pupils cannot return to some form of learning from 5 January as was originally planned, more so given the huge loss of teaching that so many have already suffered."

It is critical that these disparate opinions and strategies are cleared up in order that children's health is protected.
posts.title: Schools to Remain Open This Week, Says Swinney

posts.text:
Fit for Girls is an initiative funded by the Scottish Government that is setting an example for the whole of the UK as regards bringing about sustainable change in schools while building a positive future for girls' participation in lifelong physical activity.

The program began in 2008, and since then evidence has shown that Fit for Girls has been involved in significant fitness changes happening within schools across Scotland as part of a culture of change promoting physical activity engagement for adolescent girls in schools.

Findings from the final evaluation of Fit for Girls reveals that the programme continue sot have a positive impact on how secondary schools promote physical activity among girls, and has shown significant impact amongst low active girls.

Some of the most positive aspects of the Fit for Girls programme include increased numbers of girls-only activities,improved consultation with girlsand improved perception of health, fitness and physical activity levels among participants, their peers and families.

For more details, or to get in touch, see their website:https://www.youthsporttrust.org/fit-girls
posts.title: Fit for Girls: Promoting Fitness for Girls Through Bespoke Training

posts.text:
Education Scotland announced the appointment of Ollie Bray to the role of Strategic Director.

Ollie joined the organisation from his current role at the LEGO Foundation in Denmark, where he led the Foundations work on Technology and Play and its School Improvement agenda. He also led the Foundations COVID-19 Response on Distance Learning. He will take up post at Education Scotland in February 2021.

Prior to joining the LEGO Foundation Ollie was headteacher at Kingussie High School in Highland. Under his leadership the school became well known for its use in digital technology, its progressive senior phase curriculum and its commitment to outdoor learning. Before taking up his post in Highland he was seconded to Learning and Teaching Scotland and Education Scotland as National Adviser for Emerging Technologies in Learning. He started his teaching career as a Geography Teacher in East Lothian where he went on to hold a number of middle manager and senior leadership posts.

Throughout his career Bray has been involved in a number of National initiatives including the Scottish Government Learning Journey Review and the Employers Reference Group. He has also contributed to a number of significant international thought pieces in education including the World Economic Forum: Education 4.0 Agenda and the Education Commission: Save Our Futures Campaign. He has worked internationally with teachers, school leaders and Ministries of Education in over twenty countries, including extensive work with European SchoolNet (a network of 34 European Ministries of Education).

He was a Fellow of the Scottish College of Educational Leadership and a former Non-Executive Board Member of Inverness College: University of the Highlands and Islands. He served for a number of years on the BBC Education Advisory Council for Scotland.

Gayle Gorman, Chief Executive of Education Scotland and HM Chief Inspector, said I am delighted to welcome Ollie to Education Scotland. The addition of someone who brings such a vast range of knowledge and experience of education on both a national and indeed a global level will strengthen our team considerably and we look forward to working with him.

Ollie Bray, said Im excited to apply all that I have learned in over twenty plus years of education, business and philanthropy to contribute to Scotlands ambition to be the best place in the world for children and young people to grow, live, learn, dream and play.
posts.title: Ollie Bray Appointed as Strategic Director by Education Scotland

posts.text:
In a move that is not unsurprising in the wake of a new Covid variant, the First Minister informed MSPs about a tighter mainland lockdown plan starting immediately.

Nicola Sturgeon has confirmed schools will stay closed until February as her Government tries to get to grips with a faster spreading strain of coronavirus.

In an emergency statement on December 21, the First Minister responded to rising Covid cases by imposing a three weeklockdownfor mainland Scotland from Boxing Day.

Under the level four plan, pubs and restaurants closed, and non-essential travel out of affected local authority areas was banned.

Growing fears about the newvariant, which is responsible for a large number of infections in Scotland, has resulted in the Government extending online learning.

The move, which applies to all parts of Scotland, will be reviewed in mid January.
Another key part of the plan was to delay the return of classroom-based schooling for most pupils until January 18th at least.

However, Coronavirus case levels have continued to alarm the Government and further tightenings were announced by Sturgeon today.

She told MSPs: "I can confirm that we have now decided to extend that date and keep schools closed to the majority of pupils until the first of February. We will review this again in mid January."
posts.title: Nicola Sturgeon Announces Schools in Scotland to Close Until February

posts.text:
Scotland's Covid-19 lockdown has been extended until at least the middle of February, with most school pupils to continue learning from home.

The current restrictions, which have closed non-essential shops and seen a "stay at home" message laod down in law, had been due to expire at the end of this month.

But Scottish government ministers agreed they should be extended after a cabinet meeting on Tuesday morning.

First Minister Nicola Sturgeon told MSPs that transmission of the virus appeared to be declining but was still too high to ease restrictions.

But she hopes schools will be able to at least begin a phased return to the classroom in the middle of next month.

The level four restrictions have been in place since Boxing Day.

Meanwhile the islands of Barra and Vatersay are being moved into the top level of restrictions due to a "significant outbreak" there.

Ms Sturgeon told MSPs that lockdown was "beginning to have an impact" on the number of new infections, but said Scotland remained in a "very precarious position".

She added: "We need to be realistic that any improvement we are seeing is down, at this stage, to the fact that we are staying at home and reducing our interactions.

"Any relaxation of lockdown while case numbers, even though they might be declining, nevertheless remain very high, could quickly send the situation into reverse."
posts.title: Schools to Stay Closed in Scotland as Lockdown Extended

posts.text:
Scotland's education secretary has warned it will be a "tall order" for schools to return on 1 February.

But John Swinney said it was "premature" to give a definitive view ahead of a formal decision next week.

Mr Swinney hinted the current arrangements could be extended given the continued prevalence of the virus.

Schools are currently closed to the majority of pupils because of concerns about the new strain of Covid, with remote learning being used instead.

Asked on the BBC's Good Morning Scotland programme whether he thought schools would fully reopen on 1 February, he said: "I think that's a tall order to be honest."

Mr Swinney, who is also the deputy first minister, said it would be premature for him to give a decision at this stage, but that the government's overriding priority was "keeping everyone in our society safe."

He added: "The government will look at these questions at the Cabinet on Tuesday and the first minister will give an update to parliament, but the virus is still at a very high level in general within society and we took the view that we had to have the level of community transmission suppressed to enable us to protect the NHS."
posts.title: Scotland February School Return 'Tall Order' Warns Swinney

posts.text:
Primary and secondary schools as well as nurseries are currently closed in Scotland to the majority of pupils after a spike in Covid-19 cases, which the Scottish Government has attributed to the new variant which originated in England.

Pupils were initially due to be back to school from 18 January following a week of online learning. However, remote learning has now been extended until at least mid-February, the First Minister Nicola Sturgeon has confirmed.

i's education newsletter: news and analysis as schools try to return to normal

Heres what we know so far about the current restrictions on schools and how long they will be in place for.

What are the current rules for schools in Scotland?

Scotland entered its latest period of lockdown just before England in January, as Covid cases continued to rise around the UK.

The rules include a legal requirement to stay at home except for certain reasons, prevent indoor meetings between households and non-essential retail must remain closed schools are also closed to most pupils.

Only children deemed vulnerable and those of key workers are currently attending in-person classes.

Scotlands lockdown was scheduled to end on 1 February, but it has since been extended until at least the middle of February, meaning that schools wont be able to open until then.

When are school likely to reopen?

Initially, schools were meant to emerge from Scotlands second lockdown on 1 February.

However, updating MSPs in Holyrood in an update on 19 January, Ms Sturgeon said the risks of community transmission of Covid-19 had forced the Cabinet to delay the opening.

Ms Sturgeon said: The Cabinet decided today that except for vulnerable and key worker children school and nursery premises will remain closed until mid-February.

The situation will be reviewed on 2 February, the First Minister said, adding: If it is at all possible, as I very much hope it will be, to begin even a phased return to in-school learning in mid-February, we will.
posts.title: Latest on Scottish Schools Reopening After Covid Lockdown: When Will Schools Reopen in Scotland?

posts.text:
A council has agreed to endorse the 74m second phase of an education overhaul in a south of Scotland town.


It would complete a journey which began about a decade ago to modernise school provision in Dumfries.


The project would see a new Dumfries High School built, a major refurbishment of Dumfries Academy, and Loreburn Primary relocated.


It would mean all four secondary schools in the town had either been replaced or completely overhauled.


The original idea was for a building - possibly on the old Dumfries Infirmary site - to house all of the town's S4 to S6 pupils.


The thinking was that it could allow a broader range of subjects to be studied and improve links with nearby Crichton campus.


However, it quickly ran into problems as parents and teachers voiced reservations about the plans.


As opposition grew, the idea was eventually dropped and replaced with a plan to retain four separate secondary schools - with two completely replaced and two substantially upgraded - as well as the construction of a new learning hub.
posts.title: Dumfries Schools Overhaul Project End In Sight

posts.text:
Nicola Sturgeoninsists the number one priority of the Scottish Government is to get young people back into classes as soon as it is safe to do so.She says certain cohorts may be prioritised first, with a phased return the most likely option.

The First Ministerhas issued an update on plans to reopen schools for face-to-face learning, with the option of "blended learning" on the table.

Schools will remain closed to the majority of pupils across Scotland until the middle of February at the earliest, with a review set to take place next Tuesday (February 2).

Sturgeon said at today's coronavirus briefing that adults may need to continue making sacrifices in order to get young people back to school as soon as possible.

She said: "It would be remiss of me not to reiterate what a big priority it is for the Scottish Government, as quickly as it is safe to do so, to get children back into face-to-face learning in schools.

"It may not be the case that we can do that overnight for every young person. It may be that we have to do that in a phased way, prioritising certain cohorts, and for some having even a period of blended learning.

"These are issues we're working through and considering right now. But it comes back to something I said earlier on. All of us, we are not going to be able to do everything we used to take for granted for some time to come yet.

"We're going to be in a position to have to make choices to open up as much normality for ourselves as we can.

"I'm crystal clear that the top priority in restoring normality is for young people. Back to school and back to interacting with their friends as much as possible.

"If that means I can't go overseas or you adults watching can't go overseas for a bit longer, or we can't go to pubs or restaurants the way we did without thinking about it before the pandemic, these are the prices I think we have to be prepared to make to get children back to school."
posts.title: 'Blended Learning' Option on the Table in Nicola Sturgeon's Schools Update

posts.text:
Deputy First Minister John Swinney said the youngest pupils and those with additional support needs will be among the first to return to classrooms.

A phased return is likely for Scotland's schools when the Covid-19 lockdown restrictions are eventually eased.

Senior pupils preparing for assessment are also likely to be among the initial wave.

The majority of pupils are expected to continue learning from home.

Mr Swinney's comments followed the extension of the Covid-19 lockdown until at least the middle of February.

'Unlikely to be a binary choice'
The level four restrictions have been in place since Boxing Day.

Speaking on BBC's Good Morning Scotland, he said it was difficult to give a percentage estimate about whether schools might go back next month.

Mr Swinney told the programme: "We are looking at all possible avenues to secure the resumption of face-to-face learning and we are looking at the way in which that may be delivered.

"We have said already that that is unlikely to be a binary choice - either everybody in or everybody out.

"It is much more likely to be a phased return where we will look at particular cohorts of pupils."
posts.title: Phased Return 'Likely' for Scottish Schools Says Swinney

posts.text:
Schools could reopen to youngest pupils first under plans being considered by the Scottish Government.

Education secretary John Swinney said plans were being drawn up for classes to resume next month on a phased return basis - but only if the prevalence of coronavirus across the country had fallen enough to allow it.

But he ruled out schools reopening to all pupils at once and instead suggested that some age groups would return before others.

Children in early years learning and P1 and P2 could be considered for the first phase, as clinical research suggests they are very unlikely to transmit covid.

Senior pupils preparing for certificates could also return early to ensure they are able to complete qualifications.

Nicola Sturgeon yesterday ruled out reopening schools in early February but told MSPs she hoped that some movement would be possible by the middle of the month.

Pupils have not enjoyed face-to-face learning with teachers since before the Christmas holidays.

Speaking on BBC Good Morning Scotland, Swinney explained why all classes would be unlikely to return at once.

We are looking at all possible avenues to secure the resumption of face-to-face learning and we are looking at the way in which that might be delivered," he said.

"It's unlikely to be a binary choice of everybody in or everybody out. It's much more likely to be a phased return, where we will look at particular cohorts of pupils.

"The groups we are looking at are the very youngest pupils - in early learning, and in early primary. The analysis from our clinical advisors is that these groups are very unlikely to be transmitting the virus.

"We're also looking at the senior phase pupils, because they have certification processes coming up, and we want to ensure they have all the access to learning and teaching that they require.

"And additional supports needs pupils, whose situation is really quite challenging in many circumstances and we have to make sure those needs are met."

Asked if that meant other age groups would stay home and carry on with remote learning, Swinney continued: "It really depends on the prevalence of the virus, and the degree to which what I would describe as headroom in the numbers to see a resumption of some parts of the education system.


"We know that when the schools are in full, they contribute about 0.2 to the R level that we have. If we have part of the school infrastructure operating, that contributes a smaller amount.

"And we have to be making judgements based on the prevalence of the virus and the degree to which we have the headroom that can cope with the circulation and activity that comes with schools operating."
posts.title: 'Phased School Return' Likely for Scottish Pupils

posts.text:
If you are the parent of a creative child or teen you will know how hard it is to find good resources and a sympathetic school arts department to support your childs talent.

This is whyArtWorks Scotlandresource is so vital. This resource has been developed for artists and teachers who are looking to embed creativity into school plans, offering relevant policy, evaluation and funding information, tips on planning together and case studies from artists and teachers who have worked in partnership.

What Next

Advice on how to get started with arts, creativity and local authority contacts, as well as information on funding, monitoring and evaluation is not always so easy to find. Check out the contacts below:

Make Creative contacts

- Join alocal Creative Learning Network (CLN)and make local authority Creative Learning contacts.

- Findcreative partners on the Creativity Portal, which is a one-stop shop for community learning leaders, teachers and educators across lifelong learning. The Creativity Portal brings together a wealth of CPD resources, creative online teaching tools, examples of next and best practice, all designed to inspire and motivate students, artists and teachers alike.

- Check out this link for other ideas onmaking contacts and networking.
posts.title: Scottish Artists and Teachers Resource

posts.text:
It was announced today that 22 new schools across Scotland, with a further 3 being refurbished, after investment of 800 million.


The developments include several new campus schools. These will see a number of existing schools share a new site.


This means six additional support needs units, 30 schools, seven early learning centres and two Gaelic medium facilities and across Scotland will be refurbished or replaced.


Ministers say the work will benefit 21,000 children and young people.


Among the schools to gain from the investment are Braeview Academy in Dundee and Peebles High School in the Scottish Borders.


Fire has damaged both of them badly in recent years.


Other schools, including Broadford Primary in Skye and Highland Council's Nairn Academy will see the complete replacement of deteriorating buildings.


Meanwhile, there will be new schools built in Irvine, Elgin and Glasgow, where there is a high demand for primary school places.

posts.text:
Biden under pressure to go nuclear to get minimum wage hike

Progressives, union leaders and activists are demanding that the Biden administration use every tool available to make sure its massive coronavirus relief package includes an increase in the minimum wage.

Lynne Sladky/AP PhotoFight for $15 leaders are pressuring the White House and Congress to keep the wage increase provision in the coronavirus relief bill.

But, already, theres one place the White House has hinted it wont go.

Bidens team is leaning heavily against the idea of having Vice President Kamala Harris use her powers as president of the Senate to keep the minimum wage provision inside the relief package. She could do so if the Senate parliamentarian determines that hiking the minimum wage to $15-an-hour does not jibe with budgetary rules that allow a bill to pass with just 51 votes in the Senate. Harris, at that point, could be the tie-breaking vote to bypass the parliamentarian.

The White Houses reluctance to consider that step has set up the possibility of an early confrontation between the president and a progressive base that has to this point been pleased with his work in office.

It's a test for how we use the power of having all three, the House, the Senate and the White House, said Rep. Pramila Jayapal (D-Wash.). Let's not hand wring over this ... We should use every tool in our toolbox.

Early in his presidency, Biden has taken a historic amount of executive actions. But the president still views himself as an institutionalist, and advisers and allies say he is wary of using the Harris nuclear option.A vice president hasnt overruled a parliamentarian in more than 40 years. And while the White House is not completely ruling out the idea, officials are skeptical thatenough Democratswould vote to keep the wage provision in the relief package even if they deployed the option, a person familiar with the White Houses thinking said.

Biden has already said that increasing the minimum wage might turn into a separate negotiation from the relief package. But the administration has not been clear on how and when that separate negotiation might take place, save to affirm their commitment to it.

The President is firmly committed to raising the minimum wage to $15 an hour thats why he championed it on the campaign trail and its why he put it in his first legislative proposal, said White House spokesman Mike Gwin. That commitment will remain unshaken, regardless of what is determined to be feasible through the reconciliation process.

While the White House may not lack determination, they do lack a clear legislative path. If Democrats can not pass a minimum wage hike in a package that only requires a simple majority vote, then they will need at least ten Republicans in the Senate in addition to their entire caucus to make it law.

Progressive groups and activists arent entertaining a separate pathway for the wage increase just yet. Instead, national union heads, alongside local Fight for $15 leaders, are pressuring the White House and Congress to keep the provision in the relief bill. Rev. William Barber II, co-chair of the Poor Peoples campaign, will visit West Virginia along with Service Employees International Union members to press Sen. Joe Manchin (D-W.V.), a skeptic of a $15-an-hour minimum wage.


Video: President Biden's administration reconsiders defense advisory boards (CNBC)

Pause

Ad00:14 - up next "President Biden's administration reconsiders defense advisory boards"

Loaded:100.00%

Unmute

0



President Biden's administration reconsiders defense advisory boards








Were going to be a gathering storm in the next three weeks because this is a tipping point, said Mary Kay Henry, president of the SEIU. It absolutely needs to be in this package.

SEIU and other unions have had conversations with, or are reaching out to, other Democrats like Sens. Catherine Cortez Masto (Nev.), Kyrsten Sinema (Ariz.), and Jeanne Shaheen (N.H.). SEIU along with a number of other major labor organizations are also planning to send a letter to the White House and Congress on Friday, making the case for why a $15-an-hour wage is a critical piece of the Covid relief package.

By deferring the hyper minimum wage hike to another day were probably signing the death sentences for more Americans who are going to die because of poverty, said Joe Sanberg, a progressive activist and entrepreneur who briefed Bidens team on the issue during the transition.

But not everyone inside the Democratic tent shares the belief that the minimum wage hike has to be in the final relief package, even though they say Democrats should push as hard as possible to make it happen.

My singular objective is to deliver Covid relief, and if we could get the minimum wage in there, that would be monumental and historic, said Sen. Brian Schatz (D-Hawaii). But I also think if minimum wage tanks Covid relief that would also be monumental and historic, but not in a good way.

And others argued that Biden was right to say that he could get a wage hike done in future legislation.

Raising the minimum wage is important but its not an emergency, said Matt Bennett, a top official at the centrist-Democratic think tank Third Way. Bennett, who has been talking to both the White House and the Senate about the Covid package, said unemployment insurance running out in March is an emergency.

I believe the minimum wage will be raised within the first two years of the Biden term, Bennett added. I dont think itll get necessarily done by the next four weeks.

Behind the scenes, the White House is asking for patience. A minimum wage hike is a priority to Biden, advisers and allies say, and theyre working to build support that would aid a future negotiation, if one is needed. They note that Biden advocated for a minimum wage increase in an Oval Office meeting with business leaders on Tuesday.

The White House is insistent it has maintained open communication with progressives, including lawmakers and activist groups, on both the $15-an-hour minimum wage provision and, more broadly, the Covid relief plan. A White House official specifically cited a briefing last week with 17 progressive groups. And Jayapal said shes been in multiple conversations with the administration in the days after Biden said he didnt believe a minimum wage hike would end up in the reconciliation bill.

Jayapal and other progressive lawmakers, including Sen. Bernie Sanders (I-Vt.), are optimistic that the parliamentarian will rule that the minimum wage hike is germane to the budget process. And they are also beginning to lay the predicate for the parliamentarian to be overruled if that determination isnt made.

The parliamentarian is not an elected representative of the people, said Rep. Mark Pocan (D-Wis.). I've never heard us put everything on the balance of what the Senate parliamentarian says when it impacts, especially, a once in a century pandemic relief bill.

The recentCongressional Budget Office findingthat a $15 minimum wage would substantially impact the federal budget was seen as a boon to progressives argument for its inclusion, even as the agency found that a hike could lead to 1.4 million jobs lost over ten years. The CBO analysis also found that the wage increase would lift 900,000 Americans out of poverty.

Lawmakers are wary, however, that if Democrats dont find a way to pass the wage increase in the first relief package, it may never be passed. Jayapal bluntly said she sees no chance of attracting Republican support for the measure, making it imperative to pass it through reconciliation.

Sen. Bob Casey (D-Pa.), a Biden ally, agreed. If it cannot be in reconciliation, if that's the determination thats made and that stands, he said,it's really difficult to see it passing and getting 60 votes.
posts.title: Biden under pressure to go nuclear to get minimum wage hike

After winning the Super Bowl on Sunday, the legendary quarterback did what plenty of people do to celebrate:Tom Brady got drunk. Very, very drunk by the looks of it, according to a recent viral video already making the rounds on social media.

posts.text:
Why i think the cost of Data will explode in the next 2 years.

Companys like Facebook, Google and many other socialmedia apps with an advertising business model, will have a hart time competing for Data with techcompanines clearly trending into a privacy orientated user experience. Apple is the latest example.


IDFA or Identifier for Advertisers is a random string assigned by Apple to a users specific device. This identifier can be used to discover, and track information on a user such as in-app events or triggers. You can read more about it here.

This is really important to understand because it's the primary way companies like Facebook track you outside their own app on iOS. And its what drives the majority of target ads on the platform, which is Facebooks main business.

The biggest change in iOS 14 however is that Apple will let users opt-in to the service. Previously, they could opt-out but it wasnt really a feature that was advertised all that much meaning Facebook has all these users already on board.

With the current public discussion about data privacy and how more and more people want control over their data, its a good guess to suggest not many people would opt-in to the service.

It is important to know that IDFA doesn't collect information thats personally-identifying like your name. This does make it partially anonymous while giving the ability for advertisers to still track you.

Facebook uses what's called its Audience Network. The Audience Network is essentially a plugin for developers, developed by Facebook, to use when they want to add advertisements to their apps.

Now, Audience Network relies on IDFA to collect data and provide results on the best ads to push to certain devices.

It might be easy to think that this change will only affect Facebook really and Apple will help make data privacy even more important on the next version of iOS.

But ads are a huge reason many apps can be free and still support developers and publishers through non-direct payments. With this move according to Facebook,

We know this may severely impact publishers ability to monetize through Audience Network on iOS 14, and, despite our best efforts, may render Audience Network so ineffective on iOS 14 that it may not make sense to offer it on iOS 14 in the future. Facebook

This basically means that developers will need to look at other ad programs from possibly Google or maybe in the future Apple themselves to generate profits.

Facebook said that it expects less impact on its own advertising business since it doesn't need device-level information but losing Audience Network on an entire platform, will be a huge loss for them and a huge source of income thatll disappear.

posts.text:
I will have to go against the grain here (note: my comments relate mainly to fiction novels) and, though my number 3 Book Marketing Tip may on the surface sound counter-intuitive cynical even here goes: never talk about your book.


Thats right! Never, ever mention your story or characters. Never mention it at parties, or post out-of-context chapters on your blog (though posting chapters/samples on certain sites can be effective).


And never, ever under pain of having your eyes poked with a loaded ostrich quill make trailers describing your book of the copycat movie-style variety that no one ever watches anyway and which will definitely never go viral.


In a changing market, this stuff is all smoke and mirrors not to mention incredibly and unendingly boring.


If you want to be successful at the book marketing game, you need to reset and rethink strategy.


The reason for the advice is simple: book written, writers need to take their heads out of their posteriors and take stock. Online marketing has a lot of bells and whistles to pull and blow, sure, but unless it adheres to good old sales &marketing rules and general human psychology, all ones efforts can be to no avail.


In this vein, the following three Top 3 book marketing tips as tough-talking as they are have been drummed into me after working with some of the best editors and book pros (that I have been very fortunate to have access to over my long and not-too-illustrious career) in commercial publishing:


3. Dont be Nave!


Thats right. Get over it. No one, not even your own mother is interested in your book (thats actually kind of the point of marketing).


No one has the masochistic inclination to read 300 pages of unedited dross you think is genius but the rest of the world thinks is a gigantic, unedited bore.


As a result, going on about a book someone does not know about is as interesting as showing them an album of your baby photos: sure theyre of interest to you but are not so relevant to anyone else.


The hard truth is, not only is no one interested in your book, but no one has the time to be interested.


If they had the time, and they were already interested, you wouldnt need to be promoting it!

Be honest: do you have the time or desire to read every book someone tells you is good? Exactly.


Who does? No one, thats who. Even if youve self-pubbed it to a clanging lack of acclaim, so what? No matter how good your cover and trailer you can bet the next book on the shelf/digital store has an even better cover and a better trailer than you do.


But and this is the good news none of that has to matter to you and your book marketing aims! Why not? Simple. Turn the psychology round.


The key is to make people interested in your book that control is yours and you can do this by adapting that good old marketing maxim, sell the benefits not the product.

#2 Marketing Tip: Make Marketing Relatable

Create trailers, blogs etc. that expand upon some idea, concept, or moral prescription whatever that is related to your book. (Remember, no one wants to read the actual book itself.)


There is plenty of relatable material everywhere, from current affairs to pop culture, to align yourself with: in other words, the reasons why you wrote the book in the first place.


Write about that using your book as an example, do radio shows (very easy and cheap to do, if you know the tricks), and then all of a sudden people will be interested and will want to read your book.


For example I recently read an author article that was about the changing face of digital publishing which the writers fictional book happened to be spearheading as part of a multimedia digital book publishing concept meaning the actual book was close to being news by default of the above strategy. I even bought the book and red it.


#1 Book Marketing Tip: Youre Marketing a Book not a Movie


Just dont. Please dont. Do the world a favour and dont copy movie-style trailers theyre just too boring, basically. Even the megabucks big publishers output is insultingly dull and about as compelling as watching fish moulder.


Wrong concept, wrong medium. Wrong, wrong


What you have to do to be successful is come up with a YouTube channel and put a video out each week/two weeks using the above strategy: i.e. maybe you/someone representative of your book audiences target group/age (or even an actor portraying one of your books characters) chatting about related items in the media with a humorous/informative slant, or whatever.


Think about it: do you really want to slog through another poorly laid out book chapter on some blog, or do you really want to watch a funny YouTube video?


Exactly! Everyone does. Its human nature to want distractions not nourishment. It works: show the public a funny YouTube video and they will demand the add-on item that goes with it your book!


Oh, and the style of YouTube video I described above is by far the most popular format on YouTube so dont fight it, ride the Zeitgeist!
posts.title: Top 3 Marketing Tips Why No One Wants to Read Your Book

posts.text:
This post is in response to an agent who recently replied to me asking what exactly is it that I want him to do for me.

Eh? Its like a surgeon asking you to tell him what you think is wrong and where the best place to start the incision would be. You dont know? Well if you dont, how the heck should I?

Baffling.

Okay. So I am actually thinking of doing it the other way round and starting an agency representing agents to writers. That way I can decipher, for all those bemused unrepresented scribes out there, what appears to be a sort of literary agents secret code thats designed to make the gates to the kingdom appear open and welcoming, whilst in reality keeping them firmly closed.

Seems reasonable. And, hey, I can be reasonable too. Ill only take fifteen percent of the same amount that an agent wont make from your writing (in other words, nothing), as they have no intention of acting for you anyway.

Be that as it may, Ill leave you with the code-phrases a writer needs to look out for in ascending order of importance and arch imponderability:

1. Were currently accepting submissions, which means: Youll never hear from us again.

2. We really enjoyed reading your work, but which translates as: Didnt you know that by stating, Were currently accepting submissions, we clearly, and unambiguously, meant we didnt want to see your unsalable rubbish in the first place?

3. Every writers favourite: Send us your full manuscript, meaning; Youve waited sixteen weeks to hear back from us after having sent your trite synopsis and boring first three chapters that we didnt want to see in the first place (you just dont get it, do you see previous two points), so by way of a suitable punishment, lets string the whole torturous process out by a further sixteen months before we reject you anyway.

4. Finally, this old chestnut: Please include return postage if you want your materials sent back to you; i.e. Trust us your unpublishable manuscript will be winging itself in precisely that direction before you can type: "It was a dark and stormy night."

Nope. Me neither. Agent logic will never fail to escape me.
posts.title: The Literary Agents Secret Code: What Every Rejected Writer Needs to Know

posts.text:
1.Medicine is of all the arts the most noble; but, owing to the ignorance of those who practice it, and of those who, inconsiderately, form a judgment of them, it is at present far behind all the other arts. Their mistake appears to me to arise principally from this, that in the cities there is no punishment connected with the practice of medicine (and with it alone) except disgrace, and that does not hurt those who are familiar with it. Such persons are the figures which are introduced in tragedies, for as they have the shape, and dress, and personal appearance of an actor, but are not actors,so also physicians are many in title but very few in reality.


2. Whoever is to acquire a competent knowledge of medicine, ought to be possessed of the following advantages: a natural disposition; instruction; a favorable position for the study; early tuition; love of labour; leisure. First of all, a natural talent is required; for, when Nature leads the way to what is most excellent, instruction in the art takes place, which the student must try to appropriate to himself by reflection, becoming an early pupil in a place well adapted for instruction. He must also bring to the task a love of labour and perseverance,so that the instruction taking root may bring forth proper and abundant fruits.


3. Instruction in medicine is like the culture of the productions of the earth. For our natural disposition, is, as it were, the soil; the tenets of our teacher are, as it were, the seed; instruction in youth is like the planting of the seed in the ground at the proper season; the place where the instruction is communicated is like the food imparted to vegetables by the atmosphere; diligent study is like the cultivation of the fields;and it is time which imparts strength to all things and brings them to maturity.


4. Having brought all these requisites to the study of medicine, and having acquired a true knowledge of it, we shall thus, in travelling through the cities, beesteemed physicians not only in name but in reality. But inexperience is a bad treasure, and a bad fund to those who possess it, whether in opinion or reality, being devoid of self-reliance and contentedness, and the nurse both of timidity and audacity. For timidity betrays a want of powers, and audacity a lack of skill. They are, indeed, two things, knowledge and opinion, of which the one makes its possessor really to know, the other to be ignorant.


5. Those things which are sacred, are to be imparted only to sacred persons; and it is not lawful to impart them to the profane until they have been initiated into the mysteries of the science.

First a few facts: Addiction to drugs is caused by the drugs and (mainly) drug metabolites that remain in the body - in body fat and nerve tissue -for months and years to come. Drug use causes imbalances in neurotransmitters (those chemicals in the brain that are important for normal functioning); for example, cocaine and amphetamine abuse cause depletion of serotonin (important for sleep, associated with depression). Therefore falling asleep (especially with long-term amphetamine use) becomes impossible. Drug abuse usually leads to malnutrition, and malnutrition is a key factor in immune suppression. After the drug-induced high, there follow the "lows" with mood changes, depression, etc.

There is a difference between use and abuse, as there is a difference between a drinker and an alcoholic.
